dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A lot of people think Uber's Hong Kong IPO is just a routine expansion, but it's actually a huge, uh, strategic move in this shaky economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A lot of people think Uber's Hong Kong I P O is just a routine expansion, but it's actually a huge, uh, strategic move in this shaky economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the worlds biggest IPO so far this year, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to raise up to $12.9 billion in a landmark public listing in Hong Kong, boosting the financial markets of a city gripped by political unrest and recession. The debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange is a secondary listing for Alibaba, which initially went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2014, raising $25 billion in the worlds biggest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's aiming to raise up to $2.5 billion, which is massive, but it's already causing some market jitters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's aiming to raise up to two point five dollars billion, which is massive, but it's already causing some market jitters.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The price means that Alibaba is set to raise at least $11.3 billion, and up to $12.9 billion if a greenshoe option to list more shares is exercisedbut that looks likely since the skyrocketing demand for shares caused Alibaba to close its books earlier than expected, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially right after Alibaba's own record-breaking listing. That timing is really putting pressure on investor confidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially right after Alibaba's own record-breaking listing. That timing is really putting pressure on investor confidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the worlds biggest IPO so far this year, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to raise up to $12.9 billion in a landmark public listing in Hong Kong, boosting the financial markets of a city gripped by political unrest and recession.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're pricing shares at 200 Hong Kong dollars each, which is a ten percent premium over their London price. That's pretty bold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're pricing shares at two hundred Hong Kong dollars each, which is a ten percent premium over their London price. That's pretty bold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba said that it would price shares at $HK176 ($22.50) each, a discount of 2.9% to its New York Stock Exchange closing price (eight Hong Kong shares will be worth one U.S.-listed share), Reuters confirmed on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It is, but demand seems weaker than expected—they had to extend the book-building period, so that greenshoe option might not even happen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is, but demand seems weaker than expected-they had to extend the book-building period, so that greenshoe option might not even happen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The price means that Alibaba is set to raise at least $11.3 billion, and up to $12.9 billion if a greenshoe option to list more shares is exercisedbut that looks likely since the skyrocketing demand for shares caused Alibaba to close its books earlier than expected, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So they might only raise around $2.1 billion instead of the full amount. That could leave them with less cash than Alibaba, which is wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they might only raise around two point one dollars billion instead of the full amount. That could leave them with less cash than Alibaba, which is wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The price means that Alibaba is set to raise at least $11.3 billion, and up to $12.9 billion if a greenshoe option to list more shares is exercisedbut that looks likely since the skyrocketing demand for shares caused Alibaba to close its books earlier than expected, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And this is still the biggest IPO of 2019 so far, but it's being overshadowed by Luckin Coffee's upcoming New York debut.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And this is still the biggest I P O of twenty nineteen so far, but it's being overshadowed by Luckin Coffee's upcoming New York debut.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also be the worlds biggest IPO so far in 2019: Alibabas Hong Kong listing exceeds Ubers $8.1 billion public debut in New York and AB InBevs $5 billion IPO of its Asia business in Hong Kong earlier this year. Alibabas listing will likely be eclipsed by Saudi Arabias state oil giant Saudi Aramco, going public on the Riyadh stock exchange in December, with its IPO set to raise up to $25.6 billionthat could break Alibabas existing record for the worlds largest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is supposed to raise up to $15 billion! That's way bigger. But the real story here is how this affects Hong Kong's financial standing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is supposed to raise up to fifteen dollars billion! That's way bigger. But the real story here is how this affects Hong Kong's financial standing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will likely be eclipsed by Saudi Arabias state oil giant Saudi Aramco, going public on the Riyadh stock exchange in December, with its IPO set to raise up to $25.6 billionthat could break Alibabas existing record for the worlds largest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right—with the U.S.-China trade war, the American government is pushing companies to list closer to home. Uber choosing Hong Kong anyway is a big deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right-with the U.S.-China trade war, the American government is pushing companies to list closer to home. Uber choosing Hong Kong anyway is a big deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And with the ongoing U.S.-China trade war leading the Chinese government to call for companies to publicly list closer to home, Alibabas listing helps cement the Hong Kong Stock Exchange as one of this years largest venues for IPOsand that could set an example for other Chinese unicorns to opt for Hong Kong over the U.S. when they go public.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It could actually weaken Hong Kong's exchange as a top IPO destination this year. Other American unicorns might think twice now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It could actually weaken Hong Kong's exchange as a top I P O destination this year. Other American unicorns might think twice now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will help boost Hong Kongs financial markets, given that the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade, following more than five months of anti-government protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And all this while Alibaba is celebrating Singles Day pulling in, what, $45 billion in sales? Just insane numbers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all this while Alibaba is celebrating Singles Day pulling in, what, forty five dollars billion in sales? Just insane numbers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its eleventh edition of Singles Day, the biggest shopping event in the world, Alibaba set a new sales record of $38.4 billion in gross merchandise volume during the 24-hour shopping bonanza.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's more than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Prime Day combined. Puts everything in perspective, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's more than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Prime Day combined. Puts everything in perspective, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To compare, Singles Day far outpaces other big e-commerce days in the U.S., with Alibabas haul more than double the amount sold on last years Black Friday, Cyber Monday and Amazon Prime Day combined.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Uber's move is risky, but it's definitely one to watch as global markets keep shifting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Uber's move is risky, but it's definitely one to watch as global markets keep shifting.

HostA: It is, but demand seems weaker than expected—they had to extend the book-building period, so that greenshoe option might not even happen.
HostB: So they might only raise around $2.1 billion instead of the full amount. That could leave them with less cash than Alibaba, which is wild.
HostA: Exactly. And this is still the biggest IPO of 2019 so far, but it's being overshadowed by Luckin Coffee's upcoming New York debut.
HostB: Which is supposed to raise up to $15 billion! That's way bigger. But the real story here is how this affects Hong Kong's financial standing.
HostA: Right—with the U.S.-China trade war, the American government is pushing companies to list closer to home. Uber choosing Hong Kong anyway is a big deal.
HostB: It could actually weaken Hong Kong's exchange as a top IPO destination this year. Other American unicorns might think twice now.
HostA: And all this while Alibaba is celebrating Singles Day pulling in, what, $45 billion in sales? Just insane numbers.
HostB: Yeah, that's more than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Prime Day combined. Puts everything in perspective, doesn't it?
HostA: For sure. Uber's move is risky, but it's definitely one to watch as global markets keep shifting.
